ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have a much greater understanding of Henry Kissinger's perspective of world order. I also understand the various ways a topic can be approached through academic fields, as well as ways the university system could be reformed to create a better-educated and more open-minded citizenship.
Different forms of World Order and their challenge

I love the idea of thinking about world order, which is above grand strategy, international relations, foreign and military policy, et cetera. This big-picture approach is the perfect ending to my Yale career. It is tough to think at world-order levels...This made the course worthwhile.
Opened my eyes to a completely different set of intellectual and philosophical political theories.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The professor and his encouragement of student engagement was a huge strength. One weakness was a slightly unclear syllabus about readings and how they map onto the class.
Insight by the instructor More visual aid
The nature of the course made it difficult to drill down into specific issues that interested me. This could have been a two-semester course.

This was a fascinating course, but did not require a lot of time. If I did not do the readings there was no penalty, and no one would ever have known. Class was a discussion. Professor Hill seemed passionate about the subjects, but somewhat nonchalant about student answers and input. It was an easy class as there were very little requirements, but overall a fascinating subject and an honor to learn from Professor Hill.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class to another student. I would highly recommend this class to people outside of the Global Affairs department. And, I would especially recommend this to other divinity school students.
It was a great course that featured a visit by Henry Kissinger. That was a special treat that made a good course great.
